column1: haitian_integration_desc; While France has restored order to the rebelliuos colony of Haiti
column2: resistance and tension has persisted in the colony. If we were inbest heavily in Haiti
column3: as well as extend equal rights to the Haitians and make Haiti a part of Metropolitan France
column4: we may finally be able to calm the island's citizenry down and regain the loyalty of the haitians.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790001;Due to the Seven Years War
column2: the Haitian Revolt
column3: and the sale of Louisiana by Napoleon Bonaparte
column4: France no longer posesses it's lands in Hispaniola or New France. As the age of Imperialism begins and we look to expand our influence
column5: the question is whether we should make a return to any of our former american colonies. Though reclaiming Haiti would be a bloody campaign
column6: It is relatively defensless and without allies. However
column7: if we were to reclaim New France itself we will certainly risk war with The United Kingdom
column8: and will be gaurenteed war with the United States. While we may be able to regain some land trhough negotiations
column9: much of these lands must be regained via war
column10: something that will cause much internal unrest and international tension. If we are successful
column11: restoring French America would be a major source of pride for both ourselves and our Empire
column12: however the cost of war may be far more than the colonies are worth.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME7790001OPTA;We are but one soul separated by the sea.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME7790001OPTB;We will not shed French blood over a few acres of snow.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT7790001OPTA;We will not bow to French Demands!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT7790001OPTB;The French Canadians are more trouble than they're worth;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT7790004OPTA;War is our only option for reclaiming New France!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT7790004OPTB;Reuniting the French Canadians was a noble dream
column2: but it isn't worth it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
British forces were unable to make any gains against France. The British are willing to bring an end to the war by seceding Quebec and Acadia in its entirety
column3: however in return we would recognize British control in the rest of North America.\n\n§RNOTE: This will only give you Quebec and Acadia but NOT all of Canada
column4: this removes the ability to go for French Lousiana.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: they have suffered a immense defeat at the hands of our armies
column3: the French flag flies once again in Quebec and Acadia and British have agreed to secede the whole of British North America to our control. This is a glorious day for the French people! ;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790003;Now that we have restored French control over Canada
column2: we must decide on what to do with the English Settlers. Few wish to accept out rule
column3: any some have even begun to leave Canada to resettle elsewhere. We could mandate an expulsion program to evict the settlers
column4: however it will be costly and will earn us the ire of the United Kingdom. ;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790004;The United Kingdom has denied our geneorus offer
column2: making the peaceful aquistion of French Canada all but impossible
column3: we could declare war on the British right now
column4: or we could abandon the dream of reuniting the French Canadiens and avoid a costly war.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790005;The United Kingdom has agreed to our demands
column2: and they have offered to handover the French-speaking parts of Canada in return for a hefty sum of money. While perhaps more than what French Canada is worth
column3: It is far lower than the cost of a drawn out war with the UK.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: French armies once again occupy much of Spain. It seems there is little choice but to surrender to the French and allow them to dictate terms. If they are kind
column3: they will simply force us to admit defeat
column4: or possibly annex some of our colonial possessions. If they are unkind
column5: they may force us to give up territory in our homeland -- though doing so will surely bring about the wrath of the European powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790007;The French Army has consolidated their control over Madrid and proven their superiority in the war
column2: and thus the Spanish government has little choice but to accept any terms we dictate. The European powers are pushing for peace and conciliation -- they wish to see that France only recieves minor concessions -- though if we dare risk their wrath we could certainly wrest territorial considerations
column3: both Overseas and in Iberia itself.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: French armies once again occupy much of Spain. It seems there is little choice but to surrender to the French and allow them to dictate terms. If they are kind
column3: they will simply force us to admit defeat
column4: or possibly annex some of our colonial possessions. If they are unkind
column5: they may force us to give up territory in our homeland -- though doing so will surely bring about the wrath of the European powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790009;The French Army has consolidated their control over Madrid and proven their superiority in the war
column2: and thus the Spanish government has little choice but to accept any terms we dictate. The European powers are pushing for peace and conciliation -- they wish to see that France only recieves minor concessions -- though if we dare risk their wrath we could certainly wrest territorial considerations
column3: both Overseas and in Iberia itself.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790010;The institution of a revolutionary regime in France in led most of the European monarchies to form coalitions against it. However
column2: The military successes of the armies of the First Republic resulted in a considerable expansion of the national territory all the way to the left bank of the Rhine. While Napoleon Bonaparte would continue French conquests
column3: His eventual defeat would lead France to be stripped of it's new territory by the Congress of Vienna in 1815. The prospect of reclaiming France's natural borders
column4: however
column5: remained popular to many people both within the government and France itself. Despite it's cost in French blood and iron
column6: We have finally reclaimed France's Natural Borders. While German Nationalism and the rebellious Flemish and Dutch may upset the fragile peace
column7: for now France has proven itself to be the True master of Europe!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: commander of the whaling ship Cachalot
column3: embarked on a grandiose scheme for a French colony at Akaroa. After a dubious land purchase from Maori he established the Nanto-Bordelaise Company in France to carry out the projec
column4: and In 1839
column5: King Louis-Philippe agreed to provide assistance. The French representative for the settlement
column7: sailed for New Zealand in April 1840. A month later
column8: the ship Comte de Paris set off for Akaroa carrying 53 emigrants. The French scheme sparked debate in England and France
column9: and bowing to pressure to colonise the country
column10: the British government sent out William Hobson in 1839. He signed the Treaty of Waitangi on 6 February 1840
column11: and claimed sovereignty over the South Island on 17 June.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790012;The French government has refused to recognize the Treaty of Waitangi. Rumors of planned French colonization attempts are spreading and our government is currently debating the best course of action to take.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC7790013;The United Kingdom has ignored our complaints
column2: and maintain that the Treaty of Waitangi is valid.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790014;The United Kingdom has backed down
column2: leaving  New Zealand open to French colonization.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790015;The United Kingdom maintains that the Treaty of Waitangi is valid
column2: however they have offered to sell the islands of Australasia to us for a hefty sum.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: treaty_of_new_york_desc;The Americans have been beaten. French troops control all key cities on the Eastern Seaboard as well as the American capital
column2: giving the US no choice but to negotiate a treaty with us. We intend to demand the return of Colonial Louisiane
column3: the cession of Maine down to the Kennebec River
column4: and the revocation of any claim to said territories. For fair compensation
column5: we promise the Americans a large sum of money as well as the Anglo-dominated portions of Upper Canada
column6: as well as revoking any claim we have to the Ohio river valley.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: french_louisiana_desc;French Louisiana was an administrative district of New France. Under French control 1682 to 1762 and 1802 (nominally) to 1803
column2: the area was named in honor of King Louis XIV
column3: by French explorer Rene-Robert Cavelier
column4: Sieur de la Salle. While France lost the territory during the Seven Years' War
column5: France regained sovereignty of the western territory in the secret Treaty of San Ildefonso of 1800. But strained by obligations in Europe
column6: Napoleon Bonaparte decided to sell the territory to the United States in the Louisiana Purchase of 1803
column7: ending France's presence in Louisiana.\n\nAttempting to reconquer the vast territory of Louisana will be a mounmental task...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: integrate_guyana_desc;French Guiana has long been a colony of our nation
column2: however debates over Guiana's future is splitting opinions within our government. While some argue that French Guyana should remain a French Colonial possesion
column3: Others propoes that we could fully integrate French Guyana as a part of Metropolitan France.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: organize_acadia_desc;Acadia was a colony of New France in northeastern North America that included parts of eastern Quebec
column2: the Maritime provinces
column3: and Maine to the Kennebec River. Slowly annexed by the United Kingdom over the course of the 18th century
column4: Acadia is once again in French hands. If we intend to keep Acadia this time
column5: we must invest in the colony
column8: and building infrastructure throughout the colony. If we are successful
column9: we will have a far greater control over Canada and the North American coast.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: organize_canada_desc;Canada was the name of the French colony that once stretched along the St. Lawrence River
column2: with the other colonies of New France being Acadia
column3: Louisiana and the south shore of Newfoundland. Originally lost to the United Kingdom in 1763
column4: we have now since restored out control over Canada. If we wish to counter possible rebellion by the Anglo-Canadians or invasion by the Americans
column5: we must invest heavily in Canada
column6: ensuring that the colony has a strong french presence and an unbroken loyalty to France.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: organize_louisiana_desc;Sold to America in 1803 by Napoleon Bonaparte
column2: we have reclaimed out former colony from the Americans. Ministers within the government have suggested sending French settlers to Louisiana
column3: to settle the colony to properly consolidate our rule once more in the new world.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: we have recieved Australia in our deal with the British. While a relatively minor colony
column3: French colonial expeditions to Australia could be an important step in gaining a foothold in Southeast Asia and The Pacific.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: claim_catalonia_desc;Originally annexed from Napoleonic Spain by France in 1812
column2: It would be easy to take advantage of Spain's weakened state. While the other Greater Powers will protest
column3: Annexing Catalonia will put us one step closer to restoring the territory of the 1st French Empire.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: the_imperial_federation_desc; Ever since it's liberation from the British
column2: Canada has remained a quiet part of our Empire. It's low population
column3: combined with the relatively isolated position has led to little change. As the British slowly parition their empire into dominions
column4: the French-Canadian memebers of the national government have begun to question Canada's role in the French empire. Due to it's colonial status
column5: two paths are open for Canada. Either we can create a French-Canadian dominion in the style of the British
column6: or we could integrate Canada into metropolitan France itself. Similar successes in French Guiana has shown that distance is a non-issue. And as White
column8: Canada will be far easier to integrate compared to the Algerian departments. If we are to do this
column10: and integrate Canada before any sort of French-Canadien nationalism can arise.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: the_imperial_federation_nzl_desc;One of the most remote parts of our Empire
column2: Nouvelle-Zelande (or New Zealand) fell under French control following a standoff between the UK and France in the 1840s. Since then
column3: France has slowly settled the island
column4: though it's remoteness and low population mean that it has yet to develop a truly seperate national idenitity. While granting more autonomy to New Zealand is always an option
column5: we can also take advantage of this situation and integrate New Zealand into France itself

column1: the_imperial_federation_australia_desc;One of the more remote parts of our Empire
column2: Australia fell under French control following a standoff between the UK and France in the 1840s. Since then
column3: France has slowly settled the island
column4: though it's remoteness and low population mean that it has yet to develop a truly seperate national idenitity. While granting more autonomy to Australia is always an option
column5: we can also take advantage of this situation and integrate New Zealand into France itself

column1: the_imperial_federation_louisiana_desc; Ever since it's reconquest from the United States
column2: Louisiane has been a relatively peaceful colony. But as France turns to focus on colonial exploits in Africa and Asia
column3: the question arises on what to do with out colonies in North America. Louisiane was primarily settled in the 1840s by French settlers from France
column4: and as such it still maintains strong ties to the Motherland. If we wish to avoid our empire fracturing like that of the Spanish or the English
column5: we should take steps towards integrating Louisiane into Metropolitan France.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: claim_aosta_desc;The Aosta Valley was the first government authority to adopt Modern French as working language in 1536
column2: three years before France itself. French has been the official language of the Aosta Valley since 1561
column3: and in the 1860s
column4: over 90% of the population declared being Francophone. In addition to our claims on Savoy and Nice
column5: we will also extend our claims to the Aosta Valley as well.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: integrating_french_algeria_desc;Our attempts at settling Algeria peacefully with Frenchmen
column2: therefore overwheling the natives
column3: have failed. If we are to make Algeria a core part of France
column4: then much more drastic methods must be introduced. The reactionaires propose a harsh system of oppression
column5: forced emigration
column7: and even execution by the military if the locals refuse to follow orders. At the same time
column8: we will offer large incentives for french families to settle in Algeria
column9: to increase the Pied-Noir population. While the Liberals in France will be shocked and appalled

column1: send_settlers_to_algeria_desc;Giving citizenship and earninbg the loyalty of the native Algerians will not be enough to make Algeria French. If we truly want to establish ourselves in North Africa
column2: we must send European French settlers to Algeria as well;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: the_quebec_question_desc;Reclaiming Quebec and British controlled Acadia will be our first major goal of reuniting the overseas French. However
column2: before we resort to all-out warfare to reclaim our former American colonies
column3: we must try our hand at diplomacy first - if we offer a large sum of money
column4: as well as agreeing to ignore British 'goals' elsewhere
column5: we may be able to regain Quebec without a war.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: organize_new_zealand_desc;Now that the British have backed down
column2: New Zealand is open to French Colonization. French Names are to be given to local areas
column3: and the administration is to be re-organized
column4: and the first group of government funded settlers will set up the colonial administration. While there have been concerns that the native Maori will be a problem
column5: the Military has been dispatched to forcibly pacify the natives and enforce French rule over the Islands. A nation-wide propaganda campaign will be organized to attract settlers to the Islands
column6: to avoid the low population problems that French Lousiana and New France suffered from
column7: however the effectiveness of these policies will remain to be seen.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: walloon_autonomy_desc;Our recent annexation of Wallonia has not gone as smoothly as planned. Small cultural differences are present
column2: and the Walloon-ran local government resists our attempts to centralize power. If we were to grant Wallonia a degree of autonomy (which may be revoked later)
column3: we will be able to quell any unrest and work towards fully adding Wallonia into the French Nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: the_french_menace_desc;While Germany has only been unified for a short amount of time
column2: it has spent much of it's short history fighting the French government over ElsaB-Lothringen. Even now
column3: France continues to oppress the germans living there. If we are to ensure german superiority
column4: we must remove the French menace once and for all...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: vichy_france_desc;While our invasion of France has been a success
column2: the costs of occupation
column3: in both manpower and resources
column4: is unsustainable in the long run. If we want to continue our pacification of France
column5: we should create a puppet state in the south as a legal continuation of the French Government
column6: however under our stict jurisdiction. Northern France. and France's colonies

column1: establish_panfrenchism_desc;While France is certainly more united compared to it's German or Italian neighbors
column2: the fact remains that large amounts of French-cultured people reside outside of France's borders. The Swiss people in Romandie
column3: The Walloons in the low countries
column4: and even the French-Canadians in Quebec
column5: are all French at heart. If we were to encourage French pan-nationalism
column7: we may be able to one day re-unite the French peoples of the world under a single French flag.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790100;With the Rhineland back under French control
column2: The question has been raised as to what to do with the new "French" subjects. Despite the German nature of the West Bank
column3: The Rhinelanders had not been enemies of Revolutionairy France
column4: unlike the Spaniards or Portuguese. Prussia
column5: even after their incorporation of the Rhineland and Westphalia in 1815
column6: were regarded by the Rhinelanders with more suspicion
column7: due to their Francophile feeling. The incorporation of such a large number of non-French citizens has also brought up France's cultural diversity in other areas of the Empire
column8: such as in Algeria or Flanders. Some of the more conservative politicians call for a purely French state
column9: united in one language and culture. The Liberals
column11: call for granting the Rhinelanders autonomy similar to that of the Walloons. While Autonomy will seriously hinder our assimilation efforts
column12: it may reduce unrest in the Rhineland and prevent giving the Germans reason to intervene.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC7790101;French rule over the Rhineland has been firmly cemented in the last 15 years. The Rhenish autonomy laws
column2: as well as the cultural exchange between the Rhineland and the rest of France
column3: has finally earned the loyalty of the Rhenish people. As elements of French culture are merged with that of German culture
column4: the Rhineland
column5: while far more diverse than the rest of European France
column6: is slowly but surely becoming an integral part of our nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTOPTA7790011;We shall recognize the British claims.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB7790011;The UK must negotiate with us directly if they want us to drop our claims.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
